META.graphic_title: Sunrise Labor Corp.'s supply and labor chains
META.prose: Sunrise Labor, the Florida company that hired Salvador Hernandez to provide farmworkers to harvest crops, is closely connected to farms, packing sheds and other companies that get vegetables to store shelves. Rollover the labeled icons for more information.
META.source: Florida state records and San Antonio Express-News research

TREE.name: Supermarkets
TREE.tooltip: SM Jones sells produce to wholesalers and supermarkets.

TREE.name: SM Jones
TREE.tooltip: SM Jones is a produce packing and transport company. It is owned by four partner farms for whom it prepares and ships produce to supermarkets and wholesalers.

TREE.name: Sunrise Labor
TREE.tooltip: Sunrise Labor is run by Tommy Holt Jr. It contracts with farms to provide workers for the harvest, and in turn hires labor contractors, including Hernandez, to recruit low-wage workers.

TREE.name: Twin H Farms
TREE.tooltip: Twin H Farms is owned by Tommy Holt Sr. and managed by his son, Tommy Holt Jr., in Belle Glade, Fla.

TREE.name: Turek Farms
TREE.tooltip: Turek Farms in Kings Ferry, N.Y. is a partner of SM Jones. Jimenez Luna fled Hernandez' crew from here.

TREE.name: YCO
TREE.tooltip: Your Corporate Office Labor Corp, owned by Rusty Reaves, handled payroll and administrative tasks for Sunrise Labor.

TREE.name: Salvador Hernandez
TREE.tooltip: Farm labor contractor Salvador Hernandez recruited and managed crews of indebted workers. Juan Jimenez Luna was on one crew. Hernandez is one of several contractors working for Sunrise Labor.

TREE.name: Workers Two
TREE.tooltip: This is Salvador Hernandez' crew of indebted workers. Including Juan Jimenez Luna.
